chewster8, yes there are non english spoken parts in the movie, but there are no hardcoded subs for them and there is no "foreign spoken" subs only .. so you have to turn the english subs on just for the foreign parts, then turn them back off again  (a pain in the ass doing this 10 times in a movie) ... so this needs a new subtitle file and Ive not found one yet .. im watching the 1080p of this.  I experienced DTS dropouts on my stereo.  This seems to be common of new encoders or non scene encoders.  They are using some strange DTS audio handler or something.  To correct it extract the audio and then convert to ac3 with ffmpeg.  Only bother with that if you are having issues like I do.  Also the eng subs are delayed, you can correct that in aegisub.

pretty decent otherwise.
it also runs at 25 fps, just fyi.

The sound on this sounds like someone tryed to make DTS audio with a audio from a 1982 Walkman while sitting in a tincan. Horrible.

You need to change the audio description to:

Format:         DTS
Bit rate:        32Kbps
Channel (s):  1
Sample rate: 0

Comment: Not worth downloading

the main problem is the audio channel assignments are incorrect.  DNL uses some sort of software to upconvert to DTS and it doesn't properly map the channel assignments.  DTS doesn't use the same channel assignments as AC3, nor AAC 5.1, or wav 5.1.  if someone is ambitious they will dump the dts to 5.1 wav and then reorder the channels properly to wav 5.1 ordering and then export it to ac3.  its surely not dts, i dont know why they bother trying to fool anyone.
